TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

Staff exchanges between national and regional administrations, including (potential) candidates and neighbouring countries will be encouraged. These shall contribute to the further development, improvement and update of staff's skills and competences to prevent and combat fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

Expected Impact:

Improved investigation abilities of law enforcement officials and auditors involved in the protection of the Union’s financial interests through the acquisition of new skills, knowledge of specialised methodologies and techniques as well as an increased awareness of fraud risk indicators and the Union’s anti-fraud policy priorities. This will be measured, amongst others, by the number of participants at the events, the origin and background of participants and target audiences, the number of anti-fraud publications distributed to target audiences and the results of surveys to assess participants’ overall satisfaction with the events.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries: described in section 5 of the Call document.

 EU Member States only

 

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in sections 4 and 5 of the Call Document.

 

Admissibility

Applications must be submitted before the call deadline.

Applications must be submitted electronically via the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System. Paper submissions are no longer accepted.

Applications (including annexes and supporting documents) must be submitted using the forms provided inside the Participant Portal Electronic Submission System.

Your application must be readable, accessible and printable and contain all the requested information, required annexes and supporting documents.

A grant will not exceed 80% of the total eligible costs.

Eligibility

Training applications must be submitted by:

  1. national or regional administrations in a participating countrywhich promote the strengthening of action at European Union level to protect the Union’s financial interests (eligible for technical assistance, training and other actions); and

  2. research and educational institutes and non-profit-making entities that have been established and operating in a participating country for at least a year and promote the strengthening of action at European Union level to protect the Union’s financial interests (eligible for training and other actions).

Applications from third countries are subject to the conditions in Article 7(2) of the Hercule III Regulation => Currently, applicants from non-EU countries cannot submit applications.

To prove eligibility, all applicants must register in the Participant Register of the Participant Portal — before the call deadline — and upload the necessary documents showing legal status and origin.

Only applications by single applicants are allowed. No consortium is allowed to apply.

The budget for an action for which a grant is requested must NOT be lower than EUR 40 000. Therefore, the requested grant for the action must bigger of equal to EUR 32 000 (= 80% of EUR 40 000).

Maximum project duration: 15 months

Proposal page limits and layout: No Limit

3.   Evaluation

      3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in section 6 of the Call document.


      3.2 For submission and evaluation process, see the Call document.

 

4.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: described in section 3 of the Call document.

callDetailsJSONItem.staticAdditionalInfo:
Hercule III-funded actions aim to protect the financial interests of the European Union by preventing and combating fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

The Commission will encourage actions related to training, conference or staff exchange that are jointly undertaken by the Programme's beneficiaries in different Member States.

Maximum project duration: 15 months

The indicative available budget for this Call is EUR 1 100 000.

The grants will cover a maximum of 80% of the eligible costs of the action.

The budget for an action for which a grant is requested must NOT be lower than EUR 40 000. Therefore, the requested grant for the action must bigger of equal to EUR 32 000 (= 80% of EUR 40 000).
